descriptionHtml:
THE MOD HAS BEEN MOVED IN "MAGIC SPELLS AND ENCHANTMENTS"

Have you ever dreamed about call/conjure/summon a type of dragon that suits every character in your playthrought?
I mean, Odahviing is unique, I just love to have a dragon different form the others after the Main Quest on my side, but for a two-handed warrior in full heavy stalhrim set with a stalhrim battleaxe, wouldn't suit better a Frost Dragon? Or if have some mods that provides you being a Dremora, shouldn't you ride Alduin himself? Or ride a Serpentine one for your Nazgul-like, from Lord of the Rings, character? Or have you ever you ever wanted to just send an army of dragons against your foes?
Then, this MOD is definitively for you!

The (not so) long description

One of the main reasons I decided to play Skyrim (I'm always been a fantasy games/books/films fan) was the Dragon Riding.
In the game, you only have one dragon, Odahviing, that is actually "summonalbe" and rideable, and that was a bit disappointing while exploring locations like BlackReach (okay, perhaps I've a bit exaggerated) the Forgotten Vale or the Whole Solstheim Island. Okay, you can summon Durnehviir, but unfortunately he's not rideable.

But there was another problem: even if I LOVE Odahviing, I started getting a bit bored about it, I needed something different (why not Paathrnax, for istance?) and/or something that could have suitted better any type of character.
For a stalhrim warrior wouldn't suit better a Frost Dragon?
A Revered for a mage?
A Serpentine for a Nazgul like?
Alduin if you play as a Dremora?
An amazing Elder Dragon for your Paladin?
An Ancient for your Dark Fire Lord? ...
So i decided to create

ALL OF THEM!

Here what this mod does (all the dragons are fully rideable through the Bend Will Shout):

- Summon Dragon (Fire)
- Summon Dragon (Fire) - Medium
- Summon Dragon (Fire) - Potent
- Summon Dragon (Frost)
- Summon Dragon (Frost) - Medium
- Summon Dragon (Frost) - Potent
- Summon Blood Dragon (Fire)
- Summon Blood Dragon (Fire) - Medium
- Summon Blood Dragon (Fire) - Potent
- Summon Blood Dragon (Frost)
- Summon Blood Dragon (Frost) - Medium
- Summon Blood Dragon (Frost) - Potent
- Summon Frost Dragon (Fire) *
- Summon Frost Dragon (Fire) - Medium *
- Summon Frost Dragon (Fire) - Potent *
- Summon Frost Dragon (Frost)
- Summon Frost Dragon (Frost) - Medium
- Summon Frost Dragon (Frost) - Potent
- Summon Elder Dragon (Fire)
- Summon Elder Dragon (Fire) - Medium
- Summon Elder Dragon (Fire) - Potent
- Summon Elder Dragon (Frost)
- Summon Elder Dragon (Fire) - Medium
- Summon Elder Dragon (Fire) - Potent
- Summon Ancient Dragon (Fire)
- Summon Ancient Dragon (Fire) - Potent
- Summon Ancient Dragon (Frost)
- Summon Ancient Dragon (Frost) - Potent
- Summon Serpentine Dragon (Fire)
- Summon Serpentine Dragon (Fire) - Potent
- Summon Serpentine Dragon (Frost)
- Summon Serpentine Dragon (Frost) - Potent
- Summon Revered Dragon (Fire)
- Summon Revered Dragon (Fire) - Potent
- Summon Reverd Dragon (Frost) *
- Summon Reverd Dragon (Frost) - Potent *
- Summon Legendary Dragon (Fire)
- Summon Legendary Dragon (Fire) - Potent
- Summon Legendary Dragon (Frost)
- Summon Legendary Dragon (Frost) - Potent

*The mod is thought mainly for aestethical reasons, so I decided to create Frost Dragon that use FireBreath/FireBall and, because of CreationKit shows that Revered Dragon with FrostBreath/IceStorm were planned, but then non-added, I also made them. If you don't want these spell, just don't use their spell thomes :)

And this named dragons FULLY RIDEABLE (once mounted you will be able to fast-travel wherever you want and to tell them to attack your foes)
- Summon Alduin (with all his shouts, AlduinFireStorm included)
- Summon Alduin - Potent
- Summon Durnehviir (with a more powerful Frost Breath - same as an Ancient Dragon)
- Summon Durnehviir - Potent
- Summon Paathurnax (added Frost Breath and Ice Storm, since he's the Master of the Voice, why should he only only Fire breath or Fire Ball?)
- Summon Paathurnax - Potent
- Summon Skeletal Dragon (no rideable, he will stay on the ground, like the Labyrithian one)
- Summon Skeletal Dragon - Medium
- Summon Skeletal Dragon - Potent
- Summon Skeletal Dragon Flying (yes, fully rideable like the others)
- Summon Skeletal Dragon Flying - Medium
- Summon Skeletal Dragon Flying - Potent
- Summon Odahviing (so you'll be able to bring it with you in locations where he can't be summoned like the Solstheim Island, The Forgotten Vale...; his Fire Storm as a bonus feature ;) )
- Summon Odahviing  - Potent

WHAT DO "Medium" and "Potent" MEAN?
Since in late game and/or higher difficulties all the dragons become useless (except the Serpentine or the Legendary), I've decided to add a Medium (for Normal, Blood, Skeletal, Frost and Elder) and a Potent version for every dragon, Odahviing included (so you'll be able to summon him on Solstheim or other locations): the dragon will keep his aspect, but will use stats, level and shouts of an Ancient Dragon for the Medium version, of a  Legendary for the Potent, without the Drain Vitality (that is increadibly boring and annoying in Legendary difficulty or against powerful enemies). Read the Dragon Voice parts of the Description below.

ALL THE SPELL TOMES ARE IN RIVERWOOD, JUST FAST TRAVEL THERE AND YOU ARE SEEING THE CHEST ON YOUR LEFT, NEAR THE TREE

EDITED STUFF (OPTIONAL)
- Call dragon -> Cooldown reduced 1, 2, 5s
- Summon Durnehviir -> Colldown reduced 5, 5, 30s
- Ben Will -> Cooldown reduced 1, 2, 5s (I know it' a great decrease, but I think it is necessary since it is very difficult hitting dragons while they're not hoovering and that is very important for make dragons work well, even if you don't want to ride them; read the section below)
- Dragon Aspect -> No more once per day! You can turn into a Vampire Lord everytime, if you have the Hircine Ring you can do the same thing as a Werewolf, but can only be a true Dovahkiin one time every 24h? Oh, come on...


CONCERNING DRAGONS BEHAVIOUR (with suggestion for modders)
If you travel for a while after having summoned your dragon you'll have a weird glitch: the dragon will be teleported underground, under your feet. To solve it just USE BEND WILL SHOUT even if you don't want to ride him, he will follow you like Odahviing or Durnehviir (it's a vanilla feature, you can test it without mods, just spawn a dragon, use all the 3 words of the bend will shout on him but don't ride him, and look what he does). That's the best solution I suggest you.
In this way infact your summoned dragon will behave like Arvak : he will disappear when his time will end, but if you are riding him, he will stay there.

However it actually exist another possibility: the use of one of the Durnehviir Scripts, the DLC1DragonSummonScript, that provides the Dragon to follow you without troubles, like Durnehviir does, but the problem is that after 150 seconds (2.5 minutes, 1h in game), whatever he's doing(yeas, even if you are ridning him), THE DRAGON WILL LAND AND DIE.

CONCERNING SCREENSHOTS:
I'm having trouble taking screenshots, so I just used Images from the net. If someone wants to take some screenshots and send me I would be happy :)

EDIT: I succeeded, now I added my screenshots. Hope you enjoy!

CONCERNING SCRIPTS:
This mod is ALMOST scriptless, the only scripts it uses are the dragon skyrim scripts, without them, dragons would be weird (just the "dragoactorscript", edited so there is not the Dragon Soul Absorb when they disapper ;) )

ENHANCING DRAGON RIDING EXPERIENCE:
One way is to add this line in Skyrim.ini and your SkyrimPrefs.ini; add under
[General]
bFlyingMountFastTravelCruiseEnables=1
This will make your dragon Real-Time fast traveling (it is a feature made by Bethesda), so when you'll open the MAP and click on a location or a custom location, instead of a black screen your dragon will fly in that derection and will tell you when arrived.
If you also want to discover location while real-time fast-travelling (e.g. you're Flying across Dawnstar and you'll see "Dawnstar discovered") add this more line under your
[Gameplay]
bAllowDragonFlightLocationDiscovery=1
This is a video showing a mod that use those ini tweaks [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SYyobzcXvKU]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SYyobzcXvKU[/url]
But pay attention: even if I'm using it for more then 100 hours gameplay, I've seen lots of posts of player complaining about that not working. I suggest you doing it AFTER the Dragonborn Main Quest, anyway, so after you've learnt Dragonrend and BendWill.

If it doesn't work or mess up everything, or if you just want something better, I recomand you one of this two amazing mods:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31325/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31325/[/url]?   (Mod shown in the previous Video)
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31697/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31697/[/url]?   (Video: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lOa4if2Z_ok]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lOa4if2Z_ok[/url])

CONCERNING DRAGON VOICES:
I need some help: if you ride a dragon not from the DLC (an Elder, for istance), or Odahviing, you'll notice that when he uses his shout there will be two sounds, one for the "shout" and one gor the "effect". You'll also notice it be activating your subtitles: the dragon will say "Yol...Toor Shul" or "Fo...Kraah Diin"(even if they don't really say these words, as I said, it's just a sound, a kind of Roar). But if you now look at one from the DLC (a Legendary, for istance) or Alduin, you'll crealy hear the lack of the shout sounds, and if you active your subtitles, this dragon will not say anything. This is also a problem for "Custom shout" for dragons: I tried created a new one from the Ancient Dragon shout, which has the sounds, but when via CreationKit I switched his default one (DragonFireBreathShout05) with mine, again, no more second sound. I think the deafullt 5 version have something attached to them, but I didn't find a solution at the moment.
For these reasons since CreationKit reveals that the Serpentine and the Revered shout magnitude is the same of their cousins Ancient Dragons (you can check it here: [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Dragon]http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Dragon[/url]), I've decided to put that one in their spelllist, instead of the original one.
If someone has any ideas (or a link for a mod that solves that) his or help help would be really appreciated :)

CONCERNING DRAGON VOICES AND THE POTENT VERSION:
If you agree there could be another solution: since the DragonFireBreathShout03 and the DragonFireBalShout03 are fully voiced but not used (those are the shouts that, in theory, should use a fire version of the White Dragon, that in the final version of the game became Frost Dragon, so it only exist that version) I could edit those magnitude for better shouts for the Potent Version of summoned Dragon (late game or higher difficulties). So this could solve the Fire type dragon shouts; regarding the Frost type I was thinking about use (edit) the DragonFrostBreathShout03 and the DragonFrostBall03 (used by default by Frost Dragon) and give the Frost Dragon  the 04 ones (used by their Elder cousins) or the 05 ones (used by the Ancients) because in my opinion Frost Dragon should be more powerful. Let me know what you think about that.

TODO LIST:
Add a Master Version for all the spells and, if authors will give me persmission, add more dragons using skins from their mods.
Find a way to let Dragon use their Unrelenting Force Shout.
Maybe change the name of the Dragons and give them unique ones, suggestions are welcome!

INSTALLATION:
Put it in the Data folder, should be:
C:\Program Files (x86)\Bethesda Softworks\The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim - Legendary Edition\Data

Check if active in your Skyrim Launcher -> Data FIles


Or -> use NMM


The MOD is now for the Legendary Edition.
I'm going to release a Dawnguard ONLY version(the Dragons will use the Durnehviir script I wrote before, since you will not ride them, there will be no problems) and a Dragonborn ONLY one(like in the Legendary, as I wrote before, just use Bend Will on dragons even if you don't want to ride them to prevent weird things like dragons that fly underground). For those reasons I don't think I'm releasing a NO DLC version.


Don't forget to endorse and check up my other mods! :D : [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/39122770/?tb=mods&pUp=1][u][color=#0066cc]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/39122770/?tb=mods&pUp=1[/color][/u][/url]


Cheers, and good Skyrim you all!!!

[/font]COSA SIGNIFICANO "MEDIO" E "POTENTE"?

[/font][font=Calibri]RIGUARDO ALCOMPORTAMENTO DEI DRAGHI (con suggerimenti per modders)

Per risolverlo semplicemente USA L’URLO PIEGA VOLONTÀ anche se non vuoi cavalcarlo,ti seguirà come fanno Odahviing o Durnehviir (è una dinamica del gioco, puoi testarla anche senza mod, limitati a spawn un dragon, usa tutte e 3 le parole dell’urlo Piega Volontà su di lui ma non cavalcarlo, and osserva il suocomportamento). [/font][font=Calibri]È la miglior soluzione che possa suggerire.
[/font][font=Calibri]In questa maniera infatti il tuo drago evocato si comporterà come Arvak : sparirà quando sarà finito il suo tempo, ma se in quel momento lo stai cavalcando, resterà lì con te.

RIGUARDO LE VOCI DEI DRAGHI:
Ho bisogno di aiuto: se cavalcate un drago che non sia dei DLC (an Anziano, per esempio), o Odahviing, noterete che quando utilizza i suoi Urli ci saranno due
suoni, uno dell’”urlo” e uno per l’ "effetto". Lo noterete ancheattivando i sottotitoli: il drago dirà "Yol...Toor Shul" o "Fo...Kraah Diin"(anche se non dicono esattamente quelle parole, come ho precedentemente scritto, è solo un suono, una specie di secondo ruggito). Ma se si prende ora in esame uno dei DLC (un Leggendario, per esempio) o Alduin, sentirete chiaramente la mancanza di questi suoni, e se attiverete i sottotitoli, questo drago non dirà nulla. Questo è un ulteriore problema per gli "Urli personalizzati" per i draghi: ho provato a crearne uno partendo dall’urlodi un Drago Antico, che ha quei suoni, ma quando con il CreationKit ho scambiato il suo di default (DragonFireBreathShout05) con il mio, di nuovo, mancava il suono di cui ho parlato. Penso che le 5 predefinite abbiano qualcosa correlato ad esse, ma al momento non ho trovato soluzioni.
Per queste ragioni dato che il CreationKit rivela che la magnitudo degli urli dei draghi Serpente e Venerabile è la stessa dei loro cugini Draghi Antichi (puoi anche controllarlo qui: [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Dragon][u]http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Dragon[/u][/url][/font][font=Calibri]), ho deciso di inserire questi nella loro SpellList, invece che gli originali.
Se qualcuno avesse una qualsiasi idea (o un link per una mod che lo risolva) il suo aiuto sarebbe molto apprezzato :)

RIGUARDO ALLE VOCI DEI DRAGHI E ALLLA VERSIONE POTENTE:
Se siete d’accordo ci potrebbe essere un altra soluzione: dato che ilDragonFireBreathShout03 e il DragonFireBalShout03 sono completi di tutti i suoni (sono quelli che, in teoria,dovrebbe usare una versione di Fuoco dei Draghi Bianchi, che nella versione finale del gioco sono diventati Draghi del Gelo, e così ne esiste solo questa versione) potrei cambiare questa magnitudo per urli migliori finalizzati alla Potent Version dei draghi evocati (per un gioco avanzato o difficoltà più elevate). Dunque, questo per quanto concerne gli urli di fuoco potenziati; per quanto concerne quelli del Gelo type pensavo di usare (e quindi modificare) il DragonFrostBreathShout03 e il DragonFrostBall03 (usato di default dai Draghi del Gelo) e dare ai Draghi del Gelo gli 04 (usati dai loro cugini anziani) o gli 05 (usati dai loro cugini Antichi) anche perché nella mio opinione I Draghi Bianchi del Gelo dovrebbero essere più potenti.
